intro: Klasea nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked-stemmed klasea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has a low-growing, mat-forming habit with slender, hairless stems. Its flowers are typically yellow and are arranged in small clusters, producing small, inconspicuous fruits. Klasea nudicaulis thrives in dry, rocky environments and is often found in fynbos vegetation.
